name: John Cale
description:
'''John Davies Cale''' {{post-nominals|country=GBR|OBE}} (born 9 March 1942) is a Welsh musician, composer, and record producer who was a founding member of the American [[Rock music|rock]] band [[the Velvet Underground]]. Over his six-decade career, Cale has worked in various styles across rock, [[drone music|drone]], [[classical music|classical]], [[Avant-garde music|avant-garde]] and [[electronic music]].

John Cale studied music at [[Goldsmiths, University of London|Goldsmiths College]], [[University of London]] (UoL), before relocating in 1963 to [[New York City]]'s [[downtown music]] scene, where he performed as part of the [[Theatre of Eternal Music]] and formed the Velvet Underground. Since leaving the band in 1968, Cale has released seventeen solo [[Album#Studio|studio albums]], including the albums ''[[Paris 1919 (album)|Paris 1919]]'' (1973), ''[[Fear (John Cale album)|Fear]]'' (1974) and ''[[Music for a New Society]]'' (1982). Cale worked as a record producer on debut albums by several artists, including [[the Stooges]] and [[Patti Smith]].
